definition: going directly (without detour)/(fig.) direct/straightforward (in one's manner or speech)
straight/to straighten/fair and reasonable/frank/straightforward/(indicates continuing motion or action)/vertical/vertical downward stroke in Chinese characters
surname Zhi/Zhi (c. 2000 BC), fifth of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next
straight/to straighten/fair and reasonable/frank/straightforward/(indicates continuing motion or action)/vertical/vertical downward stroke in Chinese characters
surname Zhi/Zhi (c. 2000 BC), fifth of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God

to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)

sentences.english: But Mr Huntsman was apt to do some straight-talking of his own.
sentences.chinese: 但是洪博培更适应直来直去的方式。

sentences.english: He has always been a straight talker.
sentences.chinese: 他这个人说话一向直来直去。

sentences.english: I am a pretty straight sort of guy .
sentences.chinese: 我算是相当直来直去的人。

sentences.english: Navigation needs to be intuitive, descriptive and straightforward.
sentences.chinese: 导航需要的是直观，描述的清晰，直来直去。

definition: blunt/outspoken
straightforward/outspoken
(coll.) forthright person
lit. going round the curves and skirting the corners (idiom)/fig. to speak in a roundabout way/to equivocate/to beat about the bush
candid/frank
straightforward
frank and outspoken (idiom)/straight speaking/to say what one thinks
frank/straightforward/blunt
see 拐彎抹角|拐弯抹角[guai3 wan1 mo4 jiao3]
carefree/offhand/casual
see 直截了當|直截了当[zhi2 jie2 liao3 dang4]
lit. to go on a long detour/fig. to speak vaguely around the topic without getting to the point/to beat about the bush
stubborn/inflexible/one-track minded
to go for a walk around/fig. to speak in a roundabout way
to not bother about trifles (idiom)
to make a clear difference between what one likes and what one hates/to have well-defined likes and dislikes
